radiographic_examinations.findings: Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. There is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver demonstrates homogenous attenuation throughout with no evidence of focal lesions. No intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation; gallbladder is within normal limits. The pancreas has normal attenuation with no focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation. The spleen shows normal size and attenuation. The right and left adrenal glands are normal. Kidneys are normal and symmetric with no focal lesions or hydronephrosis. There is a small hiatal hernia. The appendix is inflamed and enlarged, measuring up to 8 mm with adjacent fat stranding and reactive mesenteric lymph nodes. A small appendicalith is noted. Urinary bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable. No free fluid in the pelvis. Visualized reproductive organs are unremarkable. No retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy. No abdominal aortic aneurysm or atherosclerotic disease. No evidence of osseous lesions or acute fracture. Abdominal and pelvic wall is within normal limits.
